org.flixel.FlxGame

type
class
extends
flash.display.Sprite
FlxGame is the heart of all flixel games, and contains a bunch of basic game loops and things. It is a long and sloppy file that you shouldn't have to worry about too much! It is basically only used to create your game object in the first place, after that FlxG and FlxState have all the useful stuff you actually need.

Static Variables

public clickableArea : nme.display.Sprite

This sprite is needed in c++ version of games.

Constructor

public new(GameSizeX : Int, GameSizeY : Int, InitialState : Class<FlxState>, ?Zoom : Float, ?GameFramerate : Int, ?FlashFramerate : Int, ?UseSystemCursor : Bool)
Instantiate a new game object.
Parameters:
GameSizeX - The width of your game in game pixels, not necessarily final display pixels (see Zoom).
GameSizeY - The height of your game in game pixels, not necessarily final display pixels (see Zoom).
InitialState - The class name of the state you want to create and switch to first (e.g. MenuState).
Zoom - The default level of zoom for the game's cameras (e.g. 2 = all pixels are now drawn at 2x). Default = 1.
GameFramerate - How frequently the game should update (default is 60 times per second).
FlashFramerate - Sets the actual display framerate for Flash player (default is 30 times per second).
UseSystemCursor - Whether to use the default OS mouse pointer, or to use custom flixel ones.

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

private _accumulator : Int

Total number of milliseconds elapsed since last update loop. Counts down as we step through the game loop.

private _created : Bool

Whether the game object's basic initialization has finished yet.

public _debugger : org.flixel.system.FlxDebugger

The debugger overlay object.

public _debuggerUp : Bool

A handy boolean that keeps track of whether the debugger exists and is currently visible.

public _flashFramerate : Int

Framerate of the Flash player (NOT the game loop). Default = 30.

private _focus : nme.display.Sprite

The "focus lost" screen (see createFocusScreen()).

private _iState : Class<FlxState>

Class type of the initial/first game state for the game, usually MenuState or something like that.

private _lostFocus : Bool

Whether the Flash player lost focus.

public _maxAccumulation : Int

Max allowable accumulation (see _accumulator). Should always (and automatically) be set to roughly 2x the flash player framerate.

public _mouse : nme.display.Sprite

Mouse cursor.

public _recording : Bool

Flag for whether a new recording is being made.

public _recordingRequested : Bool

Flag for whether a new recording was requested.

public _replay : org.flixel.system.FlxReplay

Container for a game replay object.

public _replayCallback : Void -> Void

This function, if set, is triggered when the callback stops playing.

public _replayCancelKeys : Array<String>

Array that keeps track of keypresses that can cancel a replay. Handy for skipping cutscenes or getting out of attract modes!

public _replayRequested : Bool

Flag for whether a playback of a recording was requested.

public _replayTimer : Int

Helps time out a replay if necessary.

public _replaying : Bool

Flag for whether a replay is currently playing.

public _requestedReset : Bool

A flag for keeping track of whether a game reset was requested or not.

public _requestedState : FlxState

If a state change was requested, the new state object is stored here until we switch to it.

private _soundTray : nme.display.Sprite

The sound tray display container (see createSoundTray()).

private _soundTrayBars : Array<nme.display.Bitmap>

Helps display the volume bars on the sound tray.

private _soundTrayTimer : Float

Helps us auto-hide the sound tray after a volume change.

public _state : FlxState

Current game state.

public _step : Int

Milliseconds of time per step of the game loop. FlashEvent.g. 60 fps = 16ms. Supposed to be internal

private _total : Int

Total number of milliseconds elapsed since game start.

private create(FlashEvent : nme.events.Event) : Void

Used to instantiate the guts of the flixel game object once we have a valid reference to the root.
Parameters:
FlashEvent - Just a Flash system event, not too important for our purposes.

inherited from flash.display.Sprite

private step() : Void

This is the main game update logic section. The onEnterFrame() handler is in charge of calling this the appropriate number of times each frame. This block handles state changes, replays, all that good stuff.

public stopDrag() : Void

inherited from flash.display.Sprite

inherited from flash.display.DisplayObjectContainer

private switchState() : Void

If there is a state change requested during the update loop, this function handles actual destroying the old state and related processes, and calls creates on the new state and plugs it into the game object.

public toString() : String

inherited from flash.events.EventDispatcher

private update() : Void

This function is called by step() and updates the actual game state. May be called multiple times per "frame" or draw call.

private updateSoundTray(MS : Float) : Void

This function just updates the soundtray object.
